member.name: LVFINDINFOA
member.summary: Contains information used when searching for a list-view item. This structure is identical to LV_FINDINFO but has been renamed to fit standard naming conventions.

summary.para: Type of search to perform. This member can be set to one or more of the following values:

listheader.description: Searches for a match between this structure's lParam member and the lParam member of an item's structure.
Checks to see if the item text begins with the string pointed to by the psz member. This value implies use of LVFI_STRING.

Searches based on the item text. Unless additional values are specified, the item text of the matching item must exactly match the string pointed to by the psz member. However, the search is case-insensitive.
Windows Vista and later. Equivalent to LVFI_PARTIAL.
Continues the search at the beginning if no match is found. If this flag is used by itself, it is assumed that a string search is wanted.

Finds the item nearest to the position specified in the pt member, in the direction specified by the vkDirection member. This flag is supported only by large icon and small icon modes. If LVFI_NEARESTXY is specified, all other flags are ignored.

member.name: LVFINDINFOA.psz
member.summary: Address of a null-terminated string to compare with the item text. It is valid only if LVFI_STRING or LVFI_PARTIAL is set in the flags member.

member.name: LVFINDINFOA.lParam
member.summary: Value to compare with the lParam member of a list-view item's structure. It is valid only if LVFI_PARAM is set in the flags member.

member.name: LVFINDINFOA.pt
member.summary: structure with the initial search position. It is valid only if LVFI_NEARESTXY is set in the flags member.

member.name: LVFINDINFOA.vkDirection
member.summary:
Virtual key code that specifies the direction to search. The following codes are supported:
VK_LEFT
VK_RIGHT
VK_UP
VK_DOWN
VK_HOME
VK_END
VK_PRIOR
VK_NEXT
This member is valid only if LVFI_NEARESTXY is set in the flags member.
